results.title: Shoplifting: Sharon's Story
results.creator_credit: Auro Productions, Yvonne Chotzen and Dennis Cull
results.brief_description: Tells the story of a young woman who steals from a department store and is subsequently arrested. Shows her reactions and as those of her parents, to the humiliation of search, interrogation, detention, family, confrontation and court procedure.

results.title: Shoplifting is stealing
results.creator_credit: Charles Cahill and Associates and Charles Cahill
results.brief_description: Various aspects of shoplifting are discussed including the cost to organisations and methods of protection. Dramatised incidents show how shoplifters are detected and apprehended.

results.title: Shop safety
results.brief_description: Discusses the causes and prevention of accidents and safety rules to be observed when welding, working on machinery, using hoists, using tools, lifting and pushing heavy objects and the handling of gasoline.

results.title: Shop procedures
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Mechanical Drawing”.
This film shows how finished drawings are used as detailed instructions in every step of manufacturing. From the drafting room the drawings are seen going to the blue-printing machine to the reproduced by the dozens or hundreds and distributed to all those workmen who will have a part in making the finished project, The film then shows many of these workmen at their jobs using blueprints in the pattern-making assembly shop, the foundry, the forging shop, and the assembly room.

results.title: Shop 16
results.creator_credit: Shawn Reece, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Shawn Reece had no confidence and stayed at home when he wasn’t at school. That is, until his friend convinced him to come along to Shop 16, a youth centre run by the Salvation Army in Reservoir.

results.title: Shooting: Norm Stewart
results.brief_description: Coach Norm Stewart analyses the jump-shot and one-hand free throw. The jump-shot is viewed through its various phases while the one-hand free throw is broken into four main areas: body position, ball position, aiming, and the motion.

results.title: Shooting through
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Six of the best”.
Introduces issues concerned with welfare funding, job hunting and the responsibility of employers. Antoni loses his job at the service station and Sal continues to look for secretarial work, but with no success. Founding is cut for the drop in centre.

results.title: Shooting the past
results.creator_credit: BBC, John Chapman and Stephen Poliakoff
results.brief_description: An Award winning 3 part BBC television program set in a country house on the outskirts of London which is home to a unique photographic collection which spans the 20th century. The collection is cared for by a small team of dedicated but eccentric staff whose world is shaken when an American property developer purchases the mansion and its contents. His intention is to refurbish the house, with most of the collection, and establish a modern business school on the property. The library staff entrench themselves, determined to use any creative means to stop the break up of the photographic collection. The clash of economic rationalism and heritage values is brilliantly shown, as well as the power of photographs to chronicle and shape events and decisions. Adapted by Stephen Poliakoff from his own play. Special credit to the Hulton-Getty Picture Collection for still used throughout the drama.

results.title: Shooting scene 341 [from 'the spy who loved me']
results.brief_description: Filmed on location during the shooting of scene 341 from “The Spy who loved me”. An action scene necessitating the construction of a huge and expensive set. Includes fly-on-the-wall footage of direction, rehearsal and shooting of the scene plus commentary from the director (Lewis Gilbert), the director of photography, stunt co-ordinator, and Roger Moore. Produced for Open University.
